definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: In August 1975, the emir dissolved the parliament by royal decree.
sentences.chinese: 1975年8月，巴林君主以皇家敕令解散了國會。

sentences.english: The emperor issued an edict forbidding doing trade with foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 頒佈了一項不得和外國人做生意的敕令。

sentences.english: This is the foundation of those famous acts which are called the ordinances of July.
sentences.chinese: 這裏就是所謂七月敕令的那些著名法案的實質。

sentences.english: It is thought to have suggested the assize of novel disseisin.
sentences.chinese: 據認爲，它導致了新近侵佔敕令的產生。

sentences.english: The revocation of the Edict of Nantes was signed here in '85.
sentences.chinese: 85年南特敕令的廢除是在這裏宣佈的。

sentences.english: This is the foundation of those famous acts which are called the ordinances of July. The Restoration fell.
sentences.chinese: 這裏就是所謂七月敕令的那些著名法案的實質。

definition: imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
to hand down an imperial edict
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
to award (a prize)/to confer on sb/to confer upon by authority
